comments:
When I import an EAR which has an EJB module with an associated EJB client
module, the relationship between the two doesn't appear to be preserved. To
reproduce the problem you can do the following:

1) Create an EJB project named "TestEJBProject". Accept all the defaults and
   associate with an EAR called "TestEJBProjectEAR". By default, a client
   project called "TestEJBClientProject" will also be created.

2) If you get an EJBArtifactEdit for "TestEJBProject" and call its
   getEJBClientJarModule(), you will get the correct TestEJBClientProject
   IVirtualComponent.

3) Export TestEJBProjectEAR as an EAR file to the local filesystem.

4) Delete all TestEJBProject, TestEJBClientProject and TestEJBProjectEAR from
   the workspace.

5) Import The EAR exported in step 3.

6) If you call EJBArtifactEdit's getEJBClientJarModule(), you'll now get an
   NPE:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at 
org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.ejb.componentcore.util.EJBArtifactEdit.getEJBClientJarModu
le(EJBArtifactEdit.java:222)

Created an attachment (id=24892)
This is the EAR I exported and then imported into my workspace

Created an attachment (id=24893)
Plugin project containing a sample action which calls EJBArtifactEdit's
getEJBClientJarModule()
Neeraj - Can you confirm our behavior in previous releases??

Fixed, the problem was that the reference component for EJBClient in the 
EJB .wtpmodules was not being set.
*** Bug 103862 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
